data.title: Bill Gates Net Worth: Meet Harvard's Most Successful Dropout
data.meta_description: Curious about Bill Gates' net worth and how he's made so much money? Or what he does with all that wealth? Your answers are here.
data.text:
Ever wondered how Bill Gates became so successful? Gates is among the world's most well-known people. But how did he amass such an impressive fortune?

This post will explore Bill Gates' net worth and how he became wealthy. We'll also look at Gates' philanthropic work and how he's using his wealth to improve the world.

Let's get started.

Gates is one of the richest people in the world thanks to his investment in Microsoft and other ventures. He has used his wealth to support various philanthropic causes.

Who is Bill Gates?

Bill Gates is an American software developer, corporate mogul, and philanthropist. Gates was born on October 28, 1955, in Seattle, Washington.

His mother, Mary Maxwell Gates, was on the boards of directors for the United Way and First Interstate BancSystem. His father, William H. Gates Sr., was a well-known attorney.

Gates has two sisters: Libby, who is younger, and Kristi (Kristianne), who is older. As a child, Gates became interested in computers and began coding programs on a primitive machine his father had brought home from work.

When Gates was 13, he enrolled in Lakeside School, a private preparatory school. He met Paul Allen, who would later become his business partner.

How Much is Bill Gates Worth?

According to Forbes, Gates is estimated to be worth $129 billion. A large part of his wealth comes from his share in Microsoft, the company he co-founded with Paul Allen in 1975.

Gates has also invested significant amounts of money in various businesses and charities. In addition to his work in the technology sector, Gates is a well-known philanthropist. Just like Billy Gene, his failures made him learn so many things and move on.

Is Bill Gates the Richest Person in the World?

Bill Gates does not hold the title of the world's richest person. According to Forbes World’s Billionaires List, Elon Musk holds the title of the world's richest man. Therefore, Gates is currently the fourth-richest person in the world.

However, between 1995 and 2010, as well as again from 2013 to 2017, Gates was the world's richest person.

How Much Is Bill Gates’ Net Worth?

As of November 2022, Bill Gates had an estimated net worth of $129 billion. Just like Kylie Jenner, Bill Gates' fortune comes from his business ventures. Gates' fortune comes primarily from his stake in Microsoft, the software company he co-founded with Paul Allen in 1975.

As reported by Bloomberg, Microsoft is now the world's largest PC software company. Gates has also invested heavily in several other companies, including Cascade Investment LLC, which manages his fortune, and Canadian National Railway.

He is also a significant philanthropist, having donated billions of dollars to various charitable causes through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

What Is the Source of Bill Gates’s Wealth?

Much of Bill Gates's wealth came from his co-founding of Microsoft Corporation. A 2021 annual report from Microsoft indicated that millions of people all around the world utilize Microsoft products like the Windows operating system and the Office family of productivity tools.

For example, three billion people worldwide play games across mobile phones, computers and tablets. Microsoft still expects that this number will grow to 4.5 billion by 2023.

The remaining portion of Gates' wealth is derived from his investment company, Cascade Investment LLC, and other properties, like his expansive "Xanadu" home in Medina, Washington, valued at $143 million.

He is one of the biggest land owners in the US and has invested in various businesses, such as Republic Services and Deere & Co.

How Does Bill Gates’ Net Worth Compare To Other Billionaires?

With an estimated net worth of $129 billion, Bill Gates is among the wealthiest people on the planet. But a lot of other billionaires are wealthier than Gates.

The list below includes a comparison of the richest persons in the world and how much money they are worth compared to Bill Gates net worth:

Elon Musk - $219 billion

Jeff Bezos - $171 billion

Bernard Arnault - $158 billion

Bill Gates - $129 Billion

Warren Buffett - $118 billion

Larry Page - $111 Billion

Sergey Brin - $107 Billion

Larry Ellison - $106 B

Steve Ballmer - $91.4 Billion

Mukesh Ambani - $90.7 B

Gautam Adani & family - $90 B

While Bill Gates is still one of the world's wealthiest individuals, you can see from the comparison above that he is not the richest person on the entire globe. He falls in the fourth spot behind Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, and Bernard Arnault.

Bill Gates isn't the richest person in the world anymore- according to this comparison, that title goes to Elon Musk. Although Gates is still one of the wealthiest people on the planet, it's interesting to see who else falls into that category.

Warren Buffett follows him next with an estimated net worth of $118B according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

What are Some of the Companies Bill Gates Has Invested In?

Bill Gates has invested in companies such as Berkshire Hathaway, Waste Management, Inc., Canadian National Railway Company, Caterpillar Inc., and Schrödinger, Inc.

Berkshire Hathaway, Inc. is the foundation's largest investment (BRK.B). The foundation's second-largest holding is Waste Management, Inc. (WM). With a market value of $3.1 billion, the foundation owns more than 18.6 million shares.

The Canadian National Railway Company is the foundation's third-largest holding (CNI). Over 13.07 million shares belonging to the foundation have a $1.75 billion market value.

Caterpillar Inc. (CAT), on the other hand, owns more than 7.35 million shares of Caterpillar with a market value of more than $1.7 billion.

Schrödinger, Inc., which has more than 6.9 million shares and a market value of $238 million, is the fifth-largest investment in the foundation's portfolio. This business operates in the healthcare industry. The market value of Schrödinger is $2.2 billion.

What Are Some Philanthropic Causes Bill Gates Has Donated To?

Bill Gates has donated to a variety of philanthropic causes over the years. Some of the main causes he has supported include global health, education, and environmental protection.

Regarding global health, Gates has been a major supporter of initiatives to improve vaccination rates and access to essential medicines in developing countries. In addition, he has backed research into new vaccines and treatments for various diseases, including HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis.

Gates has concentrated on expanding all children's access to high-quality education, particularly in developing nations.

Finally, Gates has been a major supporter of environmental protection initiatives, including efforts to combat climate change and reduce air pollution.

What is the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation?

In 2000, Bill Gates, the inventor of Microsoft, and his wife Melinda Gates established the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. As one of the biggest private foundations in the world, this foundation has its headquarters in Seattle, Washington.

Through facilitating access to necessary tools and opportunities, the foundation aims to raise people's standards of living. It invests in innovative programs and projects that expand access to health care, education, economic opportunity, and other basic needs worldwide.

The foundation also enhances global cooperation on critical issues such as disease prevention and response, agricultural development, and disaster relief.

Along with its grant-making activities, the foundation also funds advocacy projects to guarantee that everyone has the chance to live healthy, fulfilling lives.

What is the Giving Pledge?

The Giving Pledge is a movement to persuade extremely affluent people and families to contribute the majority of their money to charitable organizations.

The campaign was launched in 2010 by Warren Buffett and Bill and Melinda Gates, with an initial group of signatories that included 40 wealthy individuals and families from across the globe.

What is Cascade Investment?

Cascade Investment is a holding company that Bill Gates created. The company's portfolio includes investments in various businesses and industries, including but not limited to: agriculture, energy, hospitality, real estate, and technology.

In addition, Cascade Investment has a minority stake in many well-known companies, such as Berkshire Hathaway, Canadian National Railway, and Coca-Cola.

What is the Bloomberg Billionaires Index?

The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a place where you’ll find the daily ranking of the world's wealthiest persons. The index tracks the net worth of the world's billionaires and is updated daily.

Bloomberg News published this daily index and is considered one of the most accurate and authoritative measures of billionaire wealth.

What is the Forbes 400?

The Forbes 400 ranks the wealthiest people in America, compiled and published annually by Forbes magazine. In 1982, Malcolm began releasing the list. Global billionaires who have built their riches in a variety of industries are represented on the list.

What Are Some of Bill Gates’s Philanthropic Efforts?

Bill Gates has been involved in several philanthropic efforts throughout his career. Below are six of the most notable.

The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation

Bill and Melinda Gates established the private foundation known as the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. With more than $50 billion in assets, it is the largest transparently run private foundation in the world.

The foundation's goal is to "improve healthcare, lessen severe poverty globally, and increase access to education and information technology in the United States.

The Gates Millennium Scholars Program

The Gates Millennium Scholars Program is a scholarship program for low-income, minority students to promote academic excellence. The program provides full funding for the student's undergraduate education and additional graduate degrees, if necessary.

The GAVI Alliance

This is an international organization that works to increase access to immunization in developing countries.

Gates has been a major financial supporter of the organization, which has helped vaccinate over 700 million children since it was founded in 2000.

Alzheimer's Research

In 2010, Gates committed $50 million of his fortune to Alzheimer's research. He has said he hopes to find a cure for the disease within 10 years.

Vaccine Development

Gates has also been a major supporter of vaccine development, particularly in developing countries. He has committed billions of dollars to the cause and has been credited with helping to save millions of lives.

Education

Gates has long been a proponent of education reform and has donated billions of dollars to education-related causes. As well as supporting charter schools and standardized testing, he is also involved in efforts to improve teacher training.

FAQs

Who is Bill Gates?

Gates is a business magnate, software developer, philanthropist, and co-founder of Microsoft Corporation. He served as chairman, chief executive officer, and chief software architect at Microsoft during his career.

During the 1970s and 1980s, he was a pioneer in the personal computer revolution and one of the best-known entrepreneurs.

What is Bill Gates' Net Worth?

Bill Gates's networth was estimated to be 129 billion as of July 2022.

What is the Source of Bill Gates's Wealth?

Gates derives most of his money from private investments and common shares, including a reported 1% ownership in Microsoft, which is currently worth about $19 billion.

How Did Bill Gates Become the Richest Person in the World?

Bill Gates became the richest person in the world by co-founding Microsoft and turning it into the largest software company in the world.

Through his leadership and innovation, Gates has helped shape the personal computer industry and make Microsoft a household name.

What Are Some of the Companies Bill Gates Has Invested In?

Bill Gates has invested in several companies, including Microsoft, Berkshire Hathaway, Waste Management, Canadian National Railway, Deere & Co., Republic Services, and Ecolab.

What Are Some of the Philanthropic Causes Bill Gates Has Supported?

Gates has supported many philanthropic causes, including the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the world's largest private charitable foundation.

The foundation focuses on global health and development, education, and access to technology. He stated that there should be more emphasis on green energy, education, and gender equality.

Since 2000, the Gates Foundation has invested approximately $80 billion in causes such as the fight against coronavirus, HIV/AIDS, and malaria. Spending has increased significantly from a little over $1 billion each year.

What Is the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation?

Bill and Melinda Gates established the private foundation known as the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. It was launched in 2000 and is the world's largest private charitable foundation.

Other principal officers in this foundation include Co-Chair William H. Gates Sr., Chief Executive Officer Susan Desmond-Hellmann, and Chief Financial Officer Trevor Neilson.

Since its launch, the foundation has donated billions of dollars to various causes, including global health and development, education, and access to technology.

Takeaway

With a net worth of $129 billion, Bill Gates is currently the fourth-richest person in the world. His investment in Microsoft, a company he co-founded in 1975, is the source of almost all of his fortune.

His life story is one of incredible success, from his early days as a computer programming prodigy to his current status as one of the world's most influential philanthropists.
